title: You Are Using ChatGPT Wrong! Heres How to Be Ahead of 99% of ChatGPT Users
post_content: Most of us use ChatGPT wrong. We dont include examples in our prompts. We dont use roles. We dont use the right prompts. We dont use the right settings. We dont use the right temperature. We dont use the right top p. We dont use the right top k. We dont use the right repetition penalty. We dont use the right repetition penalty range. We dont use the right repetition penalty time. We dont use the right repetition penalty time range. We dont use the right repetition penalty time decay. We dont use the right repetition penalty time decay range.

title: Use Git like a senior engineer
post_content: Git is a powerful tool that feels great to use when you know how to use it. I have used these features of Git for years across teams and projects. I am still developing opinions around some workflows (like to squash or not) but the core tooling is powerful and flexible (and scriptable!).Going through Git logs. Git logs are gross to go through out of the box. Git log is basic. Using git log gives you some information. But it’s extremely high-resolution and not usually what you’re looking for.

title: How to use Git
post_content: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in computer files and coordinating work on those files among multiple people. It is primarily used for source code management in software development, but it can be used to keep track of changes in any set of files. As a distributed revision control system it is aimed at speed, data integrity, and support for distributed, non-linear workflows.
